raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The purchase history reveals strong preferences for high-quality, character-driven television series, predominantly from English-speaking studios like PBS, HBO, and BritBox. Consistently high ratings (often 4.7 to 5.0) denote a discerning taste for well-crafted narratives and strong acting, as evidenced by positive comments on storyline and performance. The consumer demonstrates a particular affinity for genres that explore complex themes often involving morality and social issues, despite occasional content warnings for violence and foul language.

Notably, there's a recurring concern with pacing; while most series are praised, there is mention of rushed endings, indicating a desire for complete and thoroughly developed narratives. This person is somewhat price-sensitive, as evidenced by varying ratings correlating with perceived value; lower-rated entries (around 3.3 to 4.0) were less emotionally engaging, leading to diminished scores.

The overall pattern showcases a preference for binge-worthy series, reflecting enjoyment of extended narratives ideal for leisurely viewership. These preferences highlight the importance of both deep storytelling and character development, alongside a cautious approach towards programs that do not meet their high expectations.

target_interaction.title: Believed Her Then, Still Believe Her
target_interaction.text:
I watched almost every minute of this dreadful disgrace of a hearing in 1991 and was convinced at the time of Professor Hill's veracity. It hurt almost as much now to have just watched this movie and still feel the anger. I am a 75-year-old woman who had faced a number of sexual harassment situations in the workplace in a professional environment yet never talked about it. These men faced no consequences for their behavior, and it would have served no purpose to report them even if there had been someone to report them to. Thank God Anita Hill came forward and with her courageous testimony and started a dialog that really made a difference. Unfortunately, there is still much to be done.

This movie was a good representation of that time and circumstances.
